alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Waldo; Interior York; Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:32PM EST until January 13 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO BRING SLIPPERY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT... .A mix of snow and light freezing rain is expected the rest of this afternoon and into this evening, eventually changing to all rain, heavy at times overnight. Snow will accumulate several inches in the mountains and foothills. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow and sleet accumulations up to 3 inches for a storm total of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations around one to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine. Portions of central and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until Midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
